wikipedia_page.main: Robert Cooper Lee Bevan (8 February 1809 – 22 July 1890) was a British banker. He served as a senior partner of Barclays Bank.

response: In about 1836 the house was bought by the banker David Bevan for his son Robert Cooper Lee Bevan on his marriage to Lady Agneta Yorke. Robert Bevan built Christ Church, Cockfosters in 1838 to provide a suitable place of worship for the district. In 1909 the estate was sold to Sir Edward Sassoon, father of Philip Sassoon (cousin of the poet Siegfried Sassoon). Sir Philip Sassoon inherited the estate in 1912 upon his father's death and went on to entertain many notable guests at Trent Park, including Charlie Chaplin and Winston Churchill.

Edwyn Robert Bevan OBE, FBA (15 February 1870 in London – 18 October 1943 in LondonGifford Lecture Series – Biography – Edwyn Bevan at www.giffordlectures.org) was a versatile British philosopher and historian of the Hellenistic world.

Edwyn Robert Bevan was the fourteenth of sixteen children of Robert Cooper Lee Bevan, a partner in Barclays Bank, and his second wife Emma Frances Shuttleworth, daughter of Philip Nicholas Shuttleworth, Bishop of Chichester.  He was educated at Monkton Combe School and at New College, Oxford.
* Edwyn Robert Bevan (15 February 1870 - 18 October 1943), philosopher
